title: Configurable enabled keys for JML condition evaluation
body:
This PR allows you to configure the *enabled keys* in the processing of the JML conditions within the *JML conditional annotation texts*. Currently, the set is hard coded and only contains `key` as the only enabled key. This means, that KeY accepts the following JML annotation texts:

* `/*@ ...*/`
* `/*+key@ ...*/`
* `/*+key+openjml@ ...*/`

but ignores

* `/*+openjml@ ...*/`
* `/*-key@ ...*/`

## Intended Change

* This PR adds a new field to the `GeneralSettings` which contains a set of enabled keys.
* You can set this field either by `-PJML_ENABLED_KEYS=a,b,c` on the CLI, or 
* via the `$HOME/.key/proofIndependentSettings.json`.

Currently, there is no GUI element to configure this element. 

**The need** for this raises from case study where you want to have the same source code as the foundation, but you have different verification runs: e.g, functional behavior under overflow absence, and a second run to prove overflow absence. Now you can differentiate the specificaton between the runs. For example:

```
//+first@ assert x>0;
//+second@ assume x>0;
```

## Question to the reviewer 

* Should there be textbox in the settings dialog?
* Should there be label in the status bar stating the current enabled keys?


## Type of pull request

- *X* New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- *X* There are changes to the (Java) code
- *X* Changes to the settings

title: Get rid of experimental flag using more fine-grained flags
body:
## Motivation 

The `experimental` flag is a bad idea. You cannot control which feature you want to activate.
Instead, you are getting a full load of functionality one activated. This PR allows you to have more fine-grained feature flags, with a well-defined backward behavior for `--experimental`. 

This PR was created for #3022 to activate the labels w/o activated all of the other untested functions. 

## Intended Change

* A new settings `FeatureSettings` which is basically a set string (features to be activated)
* A set of feature flags in places where `Main.isExperimentalMode()` were requested.
* A settings panel 
  ![image](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/104259/5241ad06-6aa0-4c27-a246-483902a2824f)
* A behavior for `--experimental`, activating all features.
* Feature flags are stored and read in the proof-independent settings
* Changes in feature flags can have an effect depending on the feature

- [x] There are changes to the (Java) code
- [x] Other: The effect of CLI parameter `--experimental`.

This pull request addresses #3367

## Intended Change

Activating a filter works immediately. 

The underlying problem is that the GUIProofTreeModel stores the selection and does not update with the selection model in the ProofTreeView.

This PR does not maintain the consistency. The redundant information was seemingly only thought to be used to store the selected node when switching proofs and restoring it when switching back. Previously it got null (despite a node being selected in the view) and  did not activate the filter.

title: Introduce JML aliases of frame conditions for better tool compatibility
body:
This pull request allows handling various aliases for frame conditions within method/block/loop contracts and loop specifications. These aliases cover the ones which are used in various other verification tools with contracts for Java-like programs, e.g., Krakatoa, OpenJML, Dafny, ACSL++, or CorC.

In particular, the following aliases are henceforth supported for frame conditions in method, block, and loop contracts as well as loop specifications:

`assignable`, *`assigns`*, *`assigning`*, `modifiable`, *`modifies`*, *`modifying`*, `writable`, *`writes`*, *`writing`*.

Upon usage of the italic versions, we throw a warning in order to distinguish expected semantics, e.g., from runtime verification, as KeY does static analysis, but (other than potentially seeing a warning) these versions are supported in the same way as the other aliases.

For loop specifications, we also support the respective aliases with the prefix `loop_`.

During discussions on this pull request, it was noted that the semantics implemented within KeY might be better captured by `modifiable`, but for legacy reasons, we do not move away from (also) using `assignable`.

## Related Issue

<!-- Please remove if this PR is not related to an issue. -->
<!-- Please add number if it is in answer to an issue. -->

This pull request addresses #3362.

## Intended Change

<!-- Please give a brief description of what behavior changes and 
     why it should be changed. -->
This pull request introduces the aliases for frame conditions which are shown above. Thereby, it increases compatibility with further tools using JML, JML variants, or JML-alikes, such as Krakatoa, OpenJML, Dafny, or ACSL++.

title: Avoid name clashes in rule applyUpdateOnRigid
body:
Fix #3254 
To prevent name clashes with bound variables, the free variables in the update and the bound variables of a formula are compared.
In case of a clash, the bound variable is renamed and a substitution is performed on the subterms of the formula automatically before applying the update.

![grafik](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/93993502/7bac8d57-a908-4902-ad00-fd5a10cae837)
now becomes
![grafik](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/93993502/6a76b42f-20e8-4af1-907a-88b8355dd8aa)

The new clash free name is created by appending a counter to the original name of the bound variable.
However: as only the variables contained in the update and the formula the update is applied on are considered, the following situation is still possible:

![grafik](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/93993502/3884c64d-9694-4f69-8eb8-a319b271dcbd)
still becomes
![grafik](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/93993502/8684593b-96da-41c8-9865-d841995cfb96)
 
Currently, there is no way to get names on higher levels than the update. So if the different meanings of ```a1``` in this situation are still of concern, it might be needed to find a solution on a higher level than ApplyUpdateOnRigidCondition, e.g. when parsing.

Tests for ApplyUpdateOnRigidCondition were also added.

title: Minor refactoring of Proof to reduce dependencies (for instance to MergeRule)
body:
This commit factors out pruning, saving and reference resolving functionality to reduce the dependencies of Proof and to make it later easier to realise correct synchronization as well as saving proofs.

Not for this PR, but we should have a discussion about what our proof object should have as basic data structure. My idea:
- merge references and linked goals to once concept independent of merge rule or proof caching
- allow to register reference resolvers that can deal with references
- ask before saving (in the GUI) if references should be resolved
  - if yes, resolve and then pass the proof to the `OutputStreamProofSaver`
  - if not, the proof is passed to `OutputStreamProofSaver` which just saves the references (and does not resolve)
  - this allows to remove the line 
        `CopyReferenceResolver.copyCachedGoals(proof, null, null, null);`
   from `OutputStreamProofSaver`. As the saver should not have specific knowledge and it should not change the proof object while saving

title: Fix consistency of proof status and tasktree icon
body:
Pruning a closed proof (and reopening it) did not update the proof status in the task tree and also did not select any node/goal.


To reproduce before this PR:

1. Load a problem
2. Close the proof
3. Prune somewhere in the middle of the proof
4. The proof is open again, but still shown as closed in the task overview and no node of the proof tree is selected.

Should be considered for KeY 2.12.2 (PR #3328)

title: Improves KeYSelectionModel usage and removed RuleAppListener from ProofTreeView
body:
Factored these changes out from PR #3335 to keep the PRs more focused

Overall:
- Reduce unnecessary event propagation and handling during automode
- TaskTree unregisters properly during automode
- Remove GUI specific functionality from KeYMediator (DelayCut behavior) to the corresponding action object. 

KeYSelectionModel
- Consistent state of KeYMediator and its selection model
- Reduction in duplicate selection events
- Clearer flow of information

ProofTreeView:
- Remove RuleAppListener
-- RuleAppListener should only be used by prover internal entitied that are required for the proof search.
    Others should not use it or listen for autoModeStarted events and unregister. ProofTreeView did not need to be a rule app listener, so this could be removed completely.

Additional synchronizations to fix that quick random clicks on start/stop caused exceptions and/or deadlocks.

title: A heap indicator in KeY's status bar
body:
This PR brings two things for a clear indication of the current heap size settings. 

1. The logging level for heap information is increased from debug to info in `Main#main()`.
   Now the line 

   ```
    [14:33:40.367] INFO  Main - Memory: total 250.0 MB, max 3948.0 MB, free 236.08212280273438 MB
   ```
   should always appear. 

2. A GUI extension for the status bar: 

   ![image](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/assets/104259/33738afa-4853-429e-bf22-deb02a37619a)

   which allows to trigger `System.gc()` and to start the `jconsole` monitoring tool.

title: Allow origin labels to be switched off completely
body:
This PR allows to fully disable origin label creation if tracking is disabled. Switching tracking of an reloading, does no longer introduce origin labels in the first place.

- OriginLabels are only created via OriginTermLabelFactory
- Services have an OriginTermLabelFactory
- TermBuilder adds origin labels only when services has a factory set
- Changing origin tracking requires reloading
- Proof object no longer depends on origin labels 
- Proof object no longer responsible for source view related initialization of relevant files (moved to source view)


The following should be considered for the midterm, but should not be a blocker for merging this PR:
- remove hard coded OriginLabel knowledge from services, termbuilder etc. and provide a more general framework (this item can also be postponed)

@Reviewers:
- any idea how to pass knowledge about origin tracking to the PreParser in a nicer manner?

Fixes #3315

title: Proof caching: use dependency graph to increase hit rate
body:
Previously when searching for a reference, the entire sequent of the old proof had to be present in the new proof.
Now, only the useful subset of the old sequent has to be present.
Tested by a unit test.

Additional functionality:
- new "shortened chains" dependency graph rendering mode.
- button in toolbar (and checkbox in options menu) to disable proof caching
- new context menu action on nodes closed by cache to re-open them
- when a referenced proof branch is pruned (= open again), any references to that branch are automatically removed (reopening previously "closed by cache" proofs)

title: Create a JSON-RPC for KeY
body:
# A remote KeY api as promised in KeY++

## Design Descisions

* We use handles to refer to large entities like, `KeYEnvironment`, `Proof`, or `Node`. 
  These handles are called `*Id` and are aligned hierarchical:
      
      EnvironemntId < ProofId < NodeId 

  If you have a `NodeId`, you can get a `ProofId` by calling `nodeId.proofId()`.


* We do not use expose any `key.core` classes. For example, Key's `Example`s are converted into `ExampleDesc` for the serialization. Every information holding class ends with `Desc`. 

* Given complex arguments (especially optional/nullable parameters) are packed into a class which ends with `Params`.

## TODO 

* [ ] Implement a client in non-java, non-jvm (Python)

title: UI: reduce number of redundant sequent draws
body:
The purpose of this PR is to improve the performance of the KeY UI. Large sequents may take a few seconds to render, so it is vital to ensure they are only rendered when needed.

Test progress:

- [x] loading an example
- [x] manual rule app
- [x] automode to close proof
- [x] View → Use Pretty Syntax, Use Unicode Symbols, Use Syntax Highlighting, Term Labels, Hide Package Prefix toggling
- [x] prune
- [x] font size increase/decrease

Broken:

- [ ] macro from context menu (node view doesn't update)
- [ ] switching proofs (see #3347)

Unknown:
- [ ] creating/disabling an abbreviation
- [ ] one step back action
- [ ] sequent update after macro (with no steps applied)
- [ ] Select goal above / below

The PR also adds some debug logging to identify any issues caused by the changes in other scenarios.

title: Problem statements in KeY file can now also be a (semi-)sequent
body:
On request, this PR changes the grammar of KeY files, s.t. problem statements can also be sequents. 

* Previous: ` problem: LBRACE term RBRACE;` 
* Now: ` problem: LBRACE termorseq RBRACE;`

This means, you are allow to write 

```
\problem {
   a,b,c 
    ==> 
     d, e, f
}
```
in KeY files.

title: One Step Simplifier: optimizations (no new rules)
body:
This PR is an alternative to #3272, it only includes the optimizations. See the commits in this branch for details. Short description of each optimization:

- replaceKnown is called only on the changed sub-term, does not rescan entire term
- term replacement key hashcode uses depth() and op()
- cycle check switches to set implementation if >30 steps are done
- configurable cycle check and protocol (default: enabled, same as previous state)

Additionally, this PR fixes a bug with the construction of replaceKnown taclet apps inside the OSS. They were horribly broken before.

In the table below, I have benchmarked the optimizations on [ShortestPath.java](https://gist.github.com/FliegendeWurst/9be15e20e3bfd0722fcdd7f5c4afebcd) (Finish Symbolic Execution).

| Description                   | Nodes | Rule apps | Time |
:------------------------------:|:-----:|:---------:|:-----:
Baseline                        | 2568  | 10,521    | 18.8s
All optimizations | 2581 | 10,537 | 16.2s (-13%)

The number of rule apps and nodes is different, but that's just because KeY's strategy is not deterministic.

More proofs (Benchmark: strategy)

| Proof | Baseline | This PR
:-:|:-:|:-:
Binary Search | 2.281s | 2.312s
SITA | 0.586s, 2.587s, 0.153s | 0.588s, 2.556, 0.153s
SumAndMax | 1.72s | 1.83s
RemoveDup | 0.649s, 0.208s, 6.221s | 0.649s, 0.221s, 6.203s
Saddleback (no OSS) | 42.0s | 41.7s
Saddleback (OSS) | 46.3s | 46.4s

Overall: 0.1% faster.. the real value of these optimizations doesn't show up with the current rulesets

title: One Step Simplifier: optimizations and new rules
body:
This PR fixes #3248 and supersedes #3256 and #3257 by optimizing the One Step Simplifier in several ways. See the commits in this branch for details.

Additionally, the following rules are added to a new `oss` ruleset included in the OSS:

- selectOfStore, selectOfCreate, selectOfAnon, selectOfMemset, selectCreatedOfAnon, dismissNonSelectedField
- elementOfUnion, elementOfArrayRange (elementOfSingleton and similar could also be useful)
- sortsDisjointModuloNull
- ifthenelse_negated
- castDel

This means that the One Step Simplifier can now simplify many heap terms in a single step. Previously this required many more proof nodes. For the file linked below, this additional ruleset is required (see https://github.com/KeYProject/key/issues/3248#issuecomment-1704775679). The ruleset is handled specially in the Simplifier so it will not be applied inside a Quantifier, seqDef Function or UpdateJunctor (essentially it should only simplify heap selects where every parameter is known).

See #3280 for benchmarks on the optimizations.

When adding the new rules, the OSS can do much more, but does not need much more time. Thanks to the optimization of the cycle check, its impact is not very high.
| Description                   | Nodes | Rule apps | Time |
:------------------------------:|:-----:|:---------:|:-----:
with new rules                  | 2229  | 98,473   | 33.5s
with new rules (no cycle check) | 2229  | 98,473   | 32.0s

cc @WolframPfeifer @mattulbrich

title: Handle bound variables in SMT unknown translation
body:
Previously, terms that cannot be translated to SMT would always be modeled as a constant `unknown_X`.
This is not correct when the term depends on a quantified variable.
The fix: model unknown terms as a function `unknown_X var_1 var_2` where `var_*` are the free variables in the unknown term.

Fixes #3262.

title: Stop automode or exit on SIGINT
body:
When KeY is interrupted using a SIGINT, the current action will be finished: either automode is stopped or KeY is terminated.
This is very useful if the GUI is not responding (e.g. in out of memory situations).

title: Add a configuration for automatic generation of changelogs by Github
body:
The creation of useful changelog are currently a huge pain. Github allows the creation of changelogs. It also supports categories based on PR labels if we configure it. 

This PR adds such configuration. 

But now we need to come up with a labeling which suits our needs. This PR is also the place for clean-up our labeling structure. 

My suggestion would like to have really abstract categories, like (Core, UI, Proof Scripts, Extensions, ...), and then kinds like `added`, `fixed`, `open`. Following [keepachangelog](https://keepachangelog.com/): 


> Types of changes
> Added for new features.
> Changed for changes in existing functionality.
> Deprecated for soon-to-be removed features.
> Removed for now removed features.
> Fixed for any bug fixes.
> Security in case of vulnerabilities.
 

Currently we have the following labels. Categorization by me.

* Category by Features/Module etc.
  * [Calculus](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Calculus) 
  * [CI](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/CI) 
  * [Command Line Interface](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Command%20Line%20Interface)
  * [Completeness](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Completeness)
  * [Counter Example Generator](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Counter%20Example%20Generator)
  * [Deployment](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Deployment)
  * [Documentation](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Documentation)
Improvements or additions to documentation
  * [Error Reporting](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Error%20Reporting)
Missing file/position info for parse errors, uncaught errors, wrong/unclear messages, ...
  * [GUI](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/GUI)
  * [Information Flow Engine](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Information%20Flow%20Engine)
  * [Proof Loading/Saving](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Proof%20Loading%2FSaving)
  * [Proof Scripts](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Proof%20Scripts)
  * [Prover Core](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Prover%20Core)
  * [SMT](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/SMT)
  * [Strategy](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Strategy)
  * [Symb. Debugger](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Symb.%20Debugger)
  * [Test Case Generator](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Test%20Case%20Generator)
  * [Test cases](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Test%20cases)
  * [Java Parser](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Java%20Parser)
  * [JavaJMLParser](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/JavaJMLParser)
  * [JML Parser](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/JML%20Parser)
  * [JML (Semantics)](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/JML%20%28Semantics%29)
  * [KeY Parser](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/KeY%20Parser)
  * [keyext.proofmanagement](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/keyext.proofmanagement) Module: keyext.proofmanagement
  * [keyext.slicing](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/keyext.slicing) Module: keyext.slicing

* By kind
  * [✋ Soundness](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/%E2%9C%8B%20Soundness)
  * [🐞 Bug](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/%3Alady_beetle%3A%20Bug)
  * [🛠 Maintenance](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/%F0%9F%9B%A0%20Maintenance)
Code quality and related things w/o functional changes

* Priority
  * [P:HIGH](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/P%3AHIGH)
  * [P:LOW](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/P%3ALOW)
  * [P:NORMAL](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/P%3ANORMAL)


* Intention of author
  * [Feature](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Feature) New feature or request
  * [Infrastructure](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Infrastructure) Changes to the Github configurations, repository or other non-source stuff
* [Wontfix](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Wontfix) This will not be worked on


* by Github
  * [dependencies](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/dependencies) Pull requests that update a dependency file
  * [github_actions](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/github_actions)
Pull requests that update GitHub Actions code
  * [good first issue](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/good%20first%20issue)
Good for newcomers  
  * [question](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/question) Further information is requested
  * [invalid](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/invalid) This doesn't seem right

* Reason to close
  * [Duplicate](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Duplicate)
This issue or pull request already exists


* Status 
  * [help wanted](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/help%20wanted)
Extra attention is needed
  * [Postponed](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Postponed)
  * [Review Request](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Review%20Request)
Waiting for review
  * [Reviewer Feedback](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Reviewer%20Feedback)
Feedback from the review needs to be addressed
  * [RFC](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/RFC)
"Request for comments" is the appeal for making and expressing your opinion on a topic.
  * [Under Review](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Under%20Review) Pull request is currently reviewed. Please assign only when you are currently doing the review!
  * [Pending](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Pending)
  * [POSTPONED::NewJavaParser](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/POSTPONED%3A%3ANewJavaParser)

* ???
  * [IgnoredTests](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/IgnoredTests)
  * [java](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/java) Pull requests that update Java code
  * [Webpage](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Webpage)
  * [Robustness](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Robustness)
  * [Small Student Task](https://github.com/KeYProject/key/labels/Small%20Student%20Task)
